alert.note: Alert for Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Northern Erie; Southern Erie (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 6:13PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Band of heavy lake effect rain with embedded thunder will impact portions of northwestern Cattaraugus, Erie and northern Chautauqua Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 611 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Cheektowaga to SUNY Fredonia. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Dunkirk, Fredonia, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Evans, Elma, Boston, Eden, Marilla, Colden, Orchard Park and Westfield. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cattaraugus; Chautauqua; Northern Erie; Southern Erie
